intro: Neolabatia stylosa, commonly known as the slender-stemmed labatia, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its slender, climbing stems and small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale yellow. Its leaves are opposite, simple, and often have a slightly hairy texture. Neolabatia stylosa is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and along stream banks.
